name: TreeTagger English POS tags
description:
An extended version of the part-of-speech tagset used in the Penn Treebank. This version is used by the English model for TreeTagger.

See also:
* https://catalog.ldc.upenn.edu/docs/LDC99T42/tagguid1.pdf
* http://www.cis.uni-muenchen.de/~schmid/tools/TreeTagger/data/Penn-Treebank-Tagset.pdf

tags.tag_description:
quotation marks
' " “ ’ „

contextual separator, left paren
Examples: (

contextual separator, right paren
Examples: )

punctuation mark, comma
Examples: ,

punctuation mark, sentence closer
Examples: .;?*

punctuation mark, colon
Examples: :

conjunction, coordinating
Examples: and, or, but

cardinal number
Examples: five, three, 13%

determiner
Examples: the, a, these

existential there
Examples: there were six boys

foreign word
Examples: mais

conjunction, subordinating or preposition
Examples: of, on, before, unless

that
Examples: that

adjective
Examples: nice, easy

adjective, comparative
Examples: nicer, easier

adjective, superlative
Examples: nicest, easiest

list item marker
Examples:

verb, modal auxiliary
Examples: may, should

noun, singular or mass
Examples: tiger, chair, laughter

noun, plural
Examples: tigers, chairs, insects

noun, proper singular
Examples: Germany, God, Alice

noun, proper plural
Examples: we met two Christmases ago

predeterminer
Examples: both his children

possessive ending
Examples: 's

pronoun, personal
Examples: me, you, it

pronoun, possessive
Examples: my, your, our

adverb
Examples: extremely, loudly, hard

adverb, comparative
Examples: better

adverb, superlative
Examples: best

adverb, particle
Examples: about, off, up

sentence, punctuation end of sentence
Examples: .

symbol
Examples: %

infinitival to
Examples: what to do?

interjection
Examples: oh, oops, gosh

verb to be, base form
Examples: be

verb to be, past tense
Examples: they were

verb to be, gerund or present participle
Examples: being is fun

verb to be, past participle
Examples: been

verb to be, non-3rd person singular present
Examples: I am

verb to be, 3rd person singular present
Examples: she is

verb to have, base form
Examples: think

verb to have, past tense
Examples: they thought

verb to have, gerund or present participle
Examples: thinking is fun

verb to have, past participle
Examples: a sunken ship

verb to have, non-3rd person singular present
Examples: I think

verb to have, 3rd person singular present
Examples: she thinks

verb, base form
Examples: think

verb, past tense
Examples: they thought

verb, gerund or present participle
Examples: thinking is fun

verb, past participle
Examples: a sunken ship

verb, non-3rd person singular present
Examples: I think

verb, 3rd person singular present
Examples: she thinks

wh-determiner
Examples: which, whatever, whichever

wh-pronoun, personal
Examples: what, who, whom

wh-pronoun, possessive
Examples: whose, whosever

wh-adverb
Examples: where, when
